ABSmodJ
Class AOSimulationModel

java.lang.Object
  ABSmodJ.AOSimulationModel

public abstract class AOSimulationModel
extends java.lang.Object

This class is extended to create a simulation model using the Activity Object World View.

It includes the time advance algorithm (see runSimulation) and a number of methods for scheduling and unscheduling Behaviour objects. A simulation model is create by extending this Class to include the following components.

Structural Components

  • Objects for implementing Entity Structures with scope Unary or Set
Data Modelling Components

  • Attributes for implementing constants and parameters
  • Methods for implementing data modules, including random variate generators
  • Inputs are implemented using Scheduled Actions and Data Modules
Output Components

  • Objects based on the OutputSet Class for implementing Sample Sets and Trajectory Sets
  • Attributes for implementing SSOVs and DSOVs
  • The OutputSet Class contains methods for implementing most DSOVs, but additional methods may be required to implementing model specific operators.
Behavioural Components

  • The initialisation is typically implemented in the constructor
  • User defined modules are implemented as methods
  • Action and Activity Constructs are implemented using separate classes
Additional requirements to setting up the Simulation Model:

  • Implement the testPreconditions method which is called by the method runSimulation for testing Activity preconditions and interruption preconditions (see code>testPreconditions). A number of methods are available for scheduling and unscheduling Behaviour objects on the sbl (scheduled behaviour list).
  • Override the method implicitStopConditions if the simulation model observation interval terminates on a condition.

The methods eventOccurred, showSBL, and showESBL are used for debugging purposes.

Author:
Gilbert Arbez

Field Detail

clock

public double clock
This is the simulation clock that represents the simulation of time (often represented by the independent variable t).

time0

public double time0
This is the time of the left hand side of the observation interval t0 (usually set to 0).

timef

public double timef
This is the time of the right hand side of the observation interval. This value is set at the end of the simulation run.

Constructor Detail

AOSimulationModel

public AOSimulationModel()
Method Detail

implicitStopCondition

public boolean implicitStopCondition()
Override this method to return true when a condition in the model indicates the end of the simulation run (implicit stop condition).

eventOccured

public void eventOccured()
Override this method to complete tasks after the execution of the SCS (of terminating events and starting events) before the advance of time. The method is useful for: 1) Implementing the update of Trajectory sets. Values of attributes used in Trajectory sets can be tested for changes, and if a change is detected, the trajectory set updated. 2) Debugging the execution of the simulation model. It is possible to place debug code to display the state of the model before time is advanced (i.e. after the model has been updated by terminating events and starting events). For example is it possible to show the contents of the sbl (scheduled behaviour list) using showsbl().

testPreconditions

public abstract void testPreconditions(Behaviour beh)
Implement this method to test preconditions and schedule Actions/Activities.

  • reschedule scheduled action objects (bootstrapping). The reference to the behaviour object that terminated is passed. This object should be check to see if it a ScheduledAction object (using the class.instance method)).
  • test all preconditions defined in Activity classes (Activity, Triggered Activity, Extended Activity and Extended Triggered Activity). When a precondition is true, an instance of the class is created, its method startingEvent is executed, and the object is scheduled using the scheduleBehaviour method or scheduleExtBehaviour.
  • The extended behaviour list is scanned to test extended activities (and extended triggered activities) for interruption preconditions that are true. If one is found to be true, then the method interruptionSCS is executed (typically the method contains a call to unscheduleBehaviour method that removes the notice from both the SBL and ESBL.
  • The verification of the preconditions can be adapted to the system. For example, the above tests can be repeated until no precondition or interruption precondition returns true.

Parameters:
beh - References behaviour object found in the SBNotice pulled off of the SBL. See the description of runSimulation().

initAOSimulModel

public void initAOSimulModel(double startTime)
For initialising the simulation model.

Parameters:
startTime - Start time of the observation interval - usually set to 0.

initAOSimulModel

public void initAOSimulModel(double startTime,
                             double endTime)
For initialising the simulation model.

Parameters:
startTime - Start of the observation interval - usually set to 0.
endTime - Explicit left hand side of the observation interval. This parameter is used to insert a StopBehaviour notice in the SBL (scheduled behaviour list) to stop the simulation run at the specified endTime.

setTimef

public void setTimef(double endTime)
Sets/resets the end time of the simulation run. This method allows the possibility of continuing the simulation run after is has terminated. This way a warm-up period can be implemented (using the initial value of the endTime) and then resetting the left-hand side of the observation interval with setTimef (actually adds a new StopBehaviour notice in the SBL).

Parameters:
endTime - Explicit left hand side of the observation interval. This parameter is used to insert a StopBehaviour notice in the SBL (scheduled behaviour list) to stop the simulation run at the specified endTime.

runSimulation

public void runSimulation()
Run the simulation. Implements the time advance algorithm using the scheduled behaviour list. The scheduled behaviour list contains a time-ordered list of schedule behaviour notices (see SBNotice). A notice contains a termination time (time stamp which reflects the time at which an activity terminates (or an scheduled action occurs) and a reference to a behaviour object (a scheduled action or activity object). The time advance algorithm is as follows: 1) Get the notice at the top of the SBL and advance the simulation clock to the termination time of the notice. 2) If the behaviour object is a StopBehaviour object, the simulation run is terminated. 3) If the behaviour object is a subclass of the ActivitySuper Class, then call its method terminatingEvent(). If the behaviour object is a subclass of the ScheduledAction class, call its method actionEvent(). 4) Call the method testPreconditions() to test activity preconditions. The reference the behaviour object from the notice pulled from the SBL is passed to the method. The method needs to be overridden. 5) Calls the method eventOccured() which can be overridden to insert additional logic at this point. see eventOccured(). 6) Calls implicitStopCondition() and terminates if the method returns true. This method can be overridden to implement implicit stop conditions.

scheduleAction

public void scheduleAction(ScheduledAction action)
This method can be used to schedule a Scheduled action.

It will determine the time at which the action occurs using its timeset() method which should provide the time at which the action is next scheduled.

Parameters:
action - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of ScheduledAction.

scheduleBehaviour

public void scheduleBehaviour(ActivitySuper activity)
This method can be used to schedule an activity It will determine the time at which the activity terminates using its duration() method. Please note that it does not execute the startingEvent() method.

Parameters:
activity - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of ActivitySuper, that is, one of Activity or TrigActivity.

scheduleExtBehaviour

public void scheduleExtBehaviour(ExtTrigActivity activity)
This method can be used to schedule an extended activity It will determine the time at which the activity terminates using its duration() method. Please note that it does not execute the startingEvent() method.

Parameters:
activity - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of ActivitySuper, that is, one of ExtActivity or ExtTrigActivity.

addSBNotice

public SBNotice addSBNotice(Behaviour beh,
                            double tm)
Schedule a behaviour object on the SBL. This method schedules the behaviour object by creating a scheduled behaviour notice (SBNotice) using its parameters which is then added to the SBL. The behaviour object class should be a subclass of ScheduledAction or ActivitySuper.

Parameters:
beh - Reference to the behaviour object
tm - Time at which the behaviour is scheduled (activity terminates or action occurs).

unscheduleBehaviour

public SBNotice unscheduleBehaviour(Behaviour beh)
Can be used to remove a behaviour object from the SBL/ESBL.

unscheduleBehaviour

public void unscheduleBehaviour(SBNotice nt)
Can be used to remove a scheduled behaviour notice object from the SBL/ESBL.

showSBL

public void showSBL()
Shows the contents of the SBL - useful for debugging. Provides a method to list the contents of the SBL by listing termination times and Class names of the behaviour object found in the scheduled behaviour notices. The list is presented in sequence of termination times.

showESBL

public void showESBL()
Shows the contents of the ESBL - useful for debugging. Provides a method to list the contents of the ESBL by listing termination times and Class names of the behaviour object found in the scheduled behaviour notices.
